src/utils/accessibilityHelpers.ts

a11yRoles
Default value : { button: 'button', text: 'text', textInput: 'textInput', image: 'image', imageButton: 'imagebutton', header: 'header', link: 'link', search: 'search', keyboardKey: 'keyboardkey', summary: 'summary', alert: 'alert', checkbox: 'checkbox', combobox: 'combobox', menu: 'menu', menuBar: 'menubar', menuItem: 'menuitem', progressBar: 'progressbar', radio: 'radio', radioGroup: 'radiogroup', scrollBar: 'scrollbar', slider: 'slider', switch: 'switch', tab: 'tab', tabList: 'tablist', timer: 'timer', toolbar: 'toolbar', } as const

Accessibility roles for React Native components
a11yStates
Default value : { disabled: {disabled: true}, enabled: {disabled: false}, selected: {selected: true}, unselected: {selected: false}, checked: {checked: true}, unchecked: {checked: false}, expanded: {expanded: true}, collapsed: {expanded: false}, busy: {busy: true}, idle: {busy: false}, } as const

Accessibility states
a11yTestHelpers
Type : object
Default value : { /** * Find all accessibility issues in component tree */ findA11yIssues: (_componentTree: any): string[] => { const issues: string[] = []; // This would be implemented with a proper accessibility testing engine // For now, return empty array return issues; }, /** * Check if component meets accessibility standards */ isA11yCompliant: (component: any): boolean => { const issues = a11yTestHelpers.findA11yIssues(component); return issues.length === 0; }, /** * Generate accessibility report */ generateA11yReport: (componentTree: any) => { const issues = a11yTestHelpers.findA11yIssues(componentTree); return { totalIssues: issues.length, criticalIssues: issues.filter(issue => issue.includes('critical')).length, warnings: issues.filter(issue => issue.includes('warning')).length, issues, isCompliant: issues.length === 0, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), }; }, }

Accessibility testing helpers
a11yTestIds
Default value : { // Login screen loginForm: 'login-form', phoneInput: 'phone-input', otpInput: 'otp-input', sendOtpButton: 'send-otp-button', loginButton: 'login-button', backButton: 'back-button', errorMessage: 'error-message', // Home screen welcomeMessage: 'welcome-message', userInfo: 'user-info', logoutButton: 'logout-button', statusCard: 'status-card', // Common elements loadingIndicator: 'loading-indicator', errorBoundary: 'error-boundary', navigationTab: 'navigation-tab', backNavigation: 'back-navigation', // Form elements textInput: 'text-input', submitButton: 'submit-button', cancelButton: 'cancel-button', confirmButton: 'confirm-button', // Content elements contentCard: 'content-card', listItem: 'list-item', headerTitle: 'header-title', sectionTitle: 'section-title', } as const

Accessibility test IDs for consistent testing
announceForAccessibility
Default value : (message: string) => { AccessibilityInfo.announceForAccessibility(message); }

Announce message to screen reader
checkColorContrast
Default value : ( foreground: string, background: string, isLargeText: boolean = false ): { ratio: number; isAACompliant: boolean; isAAACompliant: boolean; } => { // Convert hex to RGB const hexToRgb = (hex: string) => { const result = /^#?([a-f\d]{2})([a-f\d]{2})([a-f\d]{2})$/i.exec(hex); return result ? { r: parseInt(result[1], 16), g: parseInt(result[2], 16), b: parseInt(result[3], 16), } : null; }; // Calculate relative luminance const getRelativeLuminance = (rgb: {r: number; g: number; b: number}) => { const {r, g, b} = rgb; const [rs, gs, bs] = [r, g, b].map(c => { const color = c / 255; return color <= 0.03928 ? color / 12.92 : Math.pow((color + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4); }); return 0.2126 * rs + 0.7152 * gs + 0.0722 * bs; }; const fgRgb = hexToRgb(foreground); const bgRgb = hexToRgb(background); if (!fgRgb || !bgRgb) { return {ratio: 0, isAACompliant: false, isAAACompliant: false}; } const fgLuminance = getRelativeLuminance(fgRgb); const bgLuminance = getRelativeLuminance(bgRgb); const ratio = (Math.max(fgLuminance, bgLuminance) + 0.05) / (Math.min(fgLuminance, bgLuminance) + 0.05); // WCAG 2.1 standards const aaThreshold = isLargeText ? 3 : 4.5; const aaaThreshold = isLargeText ? 4.5 : 7; return { ratio, isAACompliant: ratio >= aaThreshold, isAAACompliant: ratio >= aaaThreshold, }; }

Color contrast checker
createButtonA11yProps
Default value : ( label: string, hint?: string, disabled?: boolean, testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: true, accessibilityRole: a11yRoles.button, accessibilityLabel: label, accessibilityHint: hint, accessibilityState: disabled ? a11yStates.disabled : a11yStates.enabled, testID, })

Create accessibility props for a button
createErrorA11yProps
Default value : ( errorMessage: string, testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: true, accessibilityRole: a11yRoles.alert, accessibilityLabel: `Error: ${errorMessage}`, accessibilityLiveRegion: 'assertive' as const, testID, })

Create accessibility props for error messages
createImageA11yProps
Default value : ( altText: string, isDecorative?: boolean, testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: !isDecorative, accessibilityRole: a11yRoles.image, accessibilityLabel: isDecorative ? undefined : altText, accessibilityElementsHidden: isDecorative, testID, })

Create accessibility props for images
createLoadingA11yProps
Default value : ( loadingText?: string, testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: true, accessibilityRole: a11yRoles.progressBar, accessibilityLabel: loadingText || 'Loading', accessibilityState: a11yStates.busy, testID, })

Create accessibility props for loading indicators
createNavigationA11yProps
Default value : ( label: string, hint?: string, isActive?: boolean, testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: true, accessibilityRole: a11yRoles.tab, accessibilityLabel: label, accessibilityHint: hint, accessibilityState: isActive ? a11yStates.selected : a11yStates.unselected, testID, })

Create accessibility props for navigation elements
createTextA11yProps
Default value : ( content: string, role: 'text' | 'header' = 'text', testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: true, accessibilityRole: role === 'header' ? a11yRoles.header : a11yRoles.text, accessibilityLabel: content, testID, })

Create accessibility props for text content
createTextInputA11yProps
Default value : ( label: string, hint?: string, required?: boolean, error?: boolean, testID?: string ) => ({ accessible: true, // accessibilityRole: a11yRoles.textInput, // Note: TextInput components have built-in accessibility behavior, so we omit accessibilityRole accessibilityLabel: label + (required ? ' (required)' : ''), accessibilityHint: hint, accessibilityState: error ? {...a11yStates.enabled, invalid: true} : a11yStates.enabled, testID, })

Create accessibility props for a text input
focusHelpers
Type : object
Default value : { /** * Move focus to next focusable element */ focusNext: () => { // Implementation would depend on focus management library console.log('[A11y] Focus moved to next element'); }, /** * Move focus to previous focusable element */ focusPrevious: () => { console.log('[A11y] Focus moved to previous element'); }, /** * Trap focus within container */ trapFocus: (containerId: string) => { console.log(`[A11y] Focus trapped in container: ${containerId}`); }, /** * Release focus trap */ releaseFocusTrap: () => { console.log('[A11y] Focus trap released'); }, }

Focus management helpers
isScreenReaderEnabled
Default value : async (): Promise<boolean> => { try { return await AccessibilityInfo.isScreenReaderEnabled(); } catch (error) { console.warn('[A11y] Failed to check screen reader status:', error); return false; } }

Check if screen reader is enabled
screenReaderUtils
Type : object
Default value : { /** * Announce page change */ announcePageChange: (pageName: string) => { announceForAccessibility(`Navigated to ${pageName}`); }, /** * Announce form errors */ announceFormError: (errors: string[]) => { const message = `Form has ${errors.length} error${ errors.length === 1 ? '' : 's' }: ${errors.join(', ')}`; announceForAccessibility(message); }, /** * Announce loading state */ announceLoading: (isLoading: boolean, context?: string) => { const message = isLoading ? `Loading${context ? ` ${context}` : ''}` : `Loading complete${context ? ` for ${context}` : ''}`; announceForAccessibility(message); }, /** * Announce success message */ announceSuccess: (message: string) => { announceForAccessibility(`Success: ${message}`); }, }

Screen reader utilities
setAccessibilityFocus
Default value : (reactTag: number) => { AccessibilityInfo.setAccessibilityFocus(reactTag); }

Set accessibility focus to element
validateA11yProps
Default value : ( props: any ): { isValid: boolean; warnings: string[]; } => { const warnings: string[] = []; // Check if accessible elements have labels if ( props.accessible && !props.accessibilityLabel && !props.accessibilityLabelledBy ) { warnings.push('Accessible element missing accessibilityLabel'); } // Check if buttons have proper roles if (props.onPress && !props.accessibilityRole) { warnings.push('Pressable element missing accessibilityRole'); } // Check if text inputs have proper roles if (props.onChangeText && props.accessibilityRole !== 'textInput') { warnings.push('Text input missing proper accessibilityRole'); } // Check if images have alt text if ( props.source && !props.accessibilityLabel && !props.accessibilityElementsHidden ) { warnings.push( 'Image missing accessibilityLabel or accessibilityElementsHidden' ); } return { isValid: warnings.length === 0, warnings, }; }

Validate accessibility props

src/components/quotes/AcceptRejectButtons.tsx

AcceptRejectButtons
Type : React.FC<AcceptRejectButtonsProps>
Default value : ({ onAccept, onReject, disabled = false, loading = false, acceptLabel = 'Accept', rejectLabel = 'Reject', testID = 'accept-reject-buttons', }) => { return ( <View style={styles.container} testID={testID}> <Button title={acceptLabel} onPress={onAccept} variant="primary" size="medium" disabled={disabled} loading={loading} style={styles.acceptButton} testID={`${testID}-accept`} accessibilityLabel={`${acceptLabel} quotation`} accessibilityHint="Double tap to accept this quotation" accessibilityRole="button" /> <Button title={rejectLabel} onPress={onReject} variant="outline" size="medium" disabled={disabled} loading={loading} style={styles.rejectButton} textStyle={styles.rejectButtonText} testID={`${testID}-reject`} accessibilityLabel={`${rejectLabel} quotation`} accessibilityHint="Double tap to reject this quotation" accessibilityRole="button" /> </View> ); }

AcceptRejectButtons Component

Renders Accept and Reject buttons with proper theming, accessibility, and WCAG 2.1 AA compliance. Accept button uses green primary styling, Reject button uses red secondary styling.
styles
Default value : StyleSheet.create({ container: { flexDirection: 'row', gap: 12, paddingVertical: 8, alignItems: 'center', }, acceptButton: { flex: 1, backgroundColor: '#4CAF50', // Material Green 500 - WCAG AA compliant minHeight: 44, // WCAG minimum touch target borderRadius: 8, }, rejectButton: { flex: 1, borderColor: '#F44336', // Material Red 500 - WCAG AA compliant borderWidth: 1, backgroundColor: 'transparent', minHeight: 44, // WCAG minimum touch target borderRadius: 8, }, rejectButtonText: { color: '#F44336', // Material Red 500 - matches border }, })

Styles for AcceptRejectButtons component Ensures proper spacing, colors, and minimum touch targets (44px)

src/hooks/useNotificationPolling.ts

addJitter
Default value : (baseIntervalMs: number, maxJitterMs: number): number => { const jitter = Math.random() * maxJitterMs * 2 - maxJitterMs; // ±maxJitter return Math.max(1000, baseIntervalMs + jitter); // Minimum 1 second }

Add jitter to interval to prevent thundering herd
useNotificationPolling
Default value : ( config: NotificationPollingConfig = {} ): NotificationPollingState => { const { baseIntervalSeconds = 30, maxJitterSeconds = 5, enabled = true, startImmediately = true, } = config; const {refreshNotifications, canRefreshNotifications} = useRefreshControl(); // Polling state const isPollingRef = useRef<boolean>(false); const timerRef = useRef<NodeJS.Timeout | null>(null); const lastPollAtRef = useRef<number | null>(null); const nextPollAtRef = useRef<number | null>(null); const pollCountRef = useRef<number>(0); const appStateRef = useRef<AppStateStatus>(AppState.currentState); /** * Calculate next poll time with jitter */ const calculateNextPollTime = useCallback((): number => { const baseMs = baseIntervalSeconds * 1000; const maxJitterMs = maxJitterSeconds * 1000; const intervalWithJitter = addJitter(baseMs, maxJitterMs); return Date.now() + intervalWithJitter; }, [baseIntervalSeconds, maxJitterSeconds]); /** * Execute a single poll */ const pollNow = useCallback(async (): Promise<RefreshResult> => { if (!enabled) { console.log('[NotificationPolling] Polling disabled, skipping poll'); return { success: true, refreshedApis: [], errors: [], timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), }; } console.log('[NotificationPolling] Executing poll now...'); try { lastPollAtRef.current = Date.now(); pollCountRef.current += 1; const result = await refreshNotifications(); console.log('[NotificationPolling] Poll completed:', { success: result.success, refreshedApis: result.refreshedApis.length, errors: result.errors.length, pollCount: pollCountRef.current, }); return result; } catch (error) { const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Polling failed'; console.error('[NotificationPolling] Poll error:', errorMessage); return { success: false, refreshedApis: [], errors: [{api: 'notifications' as any, error: errorMessage}], timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), }; } }, [enabled, refreshNotifications]); /** * Schedule next poll */ const scheduleNextPoll = useCallback(() => { if (!enabled || !isPollingRef.current) { return; } // Clear existing timer if (timerRef.current) { clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } // Calculate delay const nextPollTime = calculateNextPollTime(); const delay = nextPollTime - Date.now(); nextPollAtRef.current = nextPollTime; console.log( '[NotificationPolling] Scheduling next poll in', Math.round(delay / 1000), 'seconds' ); timerRef.current = setTimeout(async () => { // Only poll if we can refresh (respects debounce) if (canRefreshNotifications() && isPollingRef.current) { await pollNow(); scheduleNextPoll(); // Schedule next poll } else { console.log( '[NotificationPolling] Poll skipped (debounce or stopped), rescheduling...' ); scheduleNextPoll(); // Reschedule anyway to keep trying } }, delay); }, [enabled, calculateNextPollTime, canRefreshNotifications, pollNow]); /** * Start polling */ const startPolling = useCallback(() => { if (!enabled) { console.log('[NotificationPolling] Cannot start - polling disabled'); return; } if (isPollingRef.current) { console.log( '[NotificationPolling] Already polling, ignoring start request' ); return; } console.log('[NotificationPolling] Starting notification polling...'); isPollingRef.current = true; scheduleNextPoll(); }, [enabled, scheduleNextPoll]); /** * Stop polling */ const stopPolling = useCallback(() => { console.log('[NotificationPolling] Stopping notification polling...'); isPollingRef.current = false; nextPollAtRef.current = null; if (timerRef.current) { clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } }, []); /** * Handle app state changes */ const handleAppStateChange = useCallback( (nextAppState: AppStateStatus) => { const previousState = appStateRef.current; appStateRef.current = nextAppState; console.log( '[NotificationPolling] App state change:', previousState, '->', nextAppState ); if ( nextAppState === 'active' && (previousState === 'background' || previousState === 'inactive') ) { // App came to foreground if (enabled && !isPollingRef.current) { console.log( '[NotificationPolling] App foregrounded, resuming polling...' ); // Wait 5 seconds then resume polling setTimeout(() => { if (appStateRef.current === 'active') { startPolling(); } }, 5000); } } else if ( (nextAppState === 'background' || nextAppState === 'inactive') && isPollingRef.current ) { // App went to background console.log( '[NotificationPolling] App backgrounded, pausing polling...' ); stopPolling(); } }, [enabled, startPolling, stopPolling] ); /** * Setup app state listener */ useEffect(() => { const subscription = AppState.addEventListener( 'change', handleAppStateChange ); return () => { subscription?.remove(); }; }, [handleAppStateChange]); /** * Start polling on mount if enabled */ useEffect(() => { if (enabled && startImmediately && AppState.currentState === 'active') { console.log('[NotificationPolling] Auto-starting polling on mount'); startPolling(); } return () => { console.log('[NotificationPolling] Cleaning up on unmount'); stopPolling(); }; }, [enabled, startImmediately, startPolling, stopPolling]); return { isPolling: isPollingRef.current, lastPollAt: lastPollAtRef.current, nextPollAt: nextPollAtRef.current, pollCount: pollCountRef.current, startPolling, stopPolling, pollNow, }; }

Hook for automatic notifications polling

Integrates with existing refresh infrastructure and handles:

  • 30s + jitter polling intervals
  • Background/foreground app state transitions
  • Proper cleanup on unmount
  • Debounce respect through existing refresh system

src/hooks/useTicketPolling.ts

addJitter
Default value : (baseIntervalMs: number, maxJitterMs: number): number => { const jitter = Math.random() * maxJitterMs * 2 - maxJitterMs; // ±maxJitter return Math.max(1000, baseIntervalMs + jitter); // Minimum 1 second }

Add jitter to interval to prevent thundering herd
useTicketPolling
Default value : ( config: TicketPollingConfig = {} ): TicketPollingState => { const { baseIntervalSeconds = 30, maxJitterSeconds = 5, enabled = true, startImmediately = true, } = config; const {refreshTickets, canRefreshTickets} = useRefreshControl(); // Polling state const isPollingRef = useRef<boolean>(false); const timerRef = useRef<NodeJS.Timeout | null>(null); const lastPollAtRef = useRef<number | null>(null); const nextPollAtRef = useRef<number | null>(null); const pollCountRef = useRef<number>(0); const appStateRef = useRef<AppStateStatus>(AppState.currentState); /** * Calculate next poll time with jitter */ const calculateNextPollTime = useCallback((): number => { const baseMs = baseIntervalSeconds * 1000; const maxJitterMs = maxJitterSeconds * 1000; const intervalWithJitter = addJitter(baseMs, maxJitterMs); return Date.now() + intervalWithJitter; }, [baseIntervalSeconds, maxJitterSeconds]); /** * Execute a single poll */ const pollNow = useCallback(async (): Promise<RefreshResult> => { if (!enabled) { console.log('[TicketPolling] Polling disabled, skipping poll'); return { success: true, refreshedApis: [], errors: [], timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), }; } console.log('[TicketPolling] Executing poll now...'); try { lastPollAtRef.current = Date.now(); pollCountRef.current += 1; const result = await refreshTickets(); console.log('[TicketPolling] Poll completed:', { success: result.success, refreshedApis: result.refreshedApis.length, errors: result.errors.length, pollCount: pollCountRef.current, }); return result; } catch (error) { const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Ticket polling failed'; console.error('[TicketPolling] Poll error:', errorMessage); return { success: false, refreshedApis: [], errors: [{api: 'tickets' as any, error: errorMessage}], timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), }; } }, [enabled, refreshTickets]); /** * Schedule next poll */ const scheduleNextPoll = useCallback(() => { if (!enabled || !isPollingRef.current) { return; } // Clear existing timer if (timerRef.current) { clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } // Calculate delay const nextPollTime = calculateNextPollTime(); const delay = nextPollTime - Date.now(); nextPollAtRef.current = nextPollTime; console.log( '[TicketPolling] Scheduling next poll in', Math.round(delay / 1000), 'seconds' ); timerRef.current = setTimeout(async () => { // Only poll if we can refresh (respects 60s debounce) if (canRefreshTickets() && isPollingRef.current) { await pollNow(); scheduleNextPoll(); // Schedule next poll } else { console.log( '[TicketPolling] Poll skipped (debounce or stopped), rescheduling...' ); scheduleNextPoll(); // Reschedule anyway to keep trying } }, delay); }, [enabled, calculateNextPollTime, canRefreshTickets, pollNow]); /** * Start polling */ const startPolling = useCallback(() => { if (!enabled) { console.log('[TicketPolling] Cannot start - polling disabled'); return; } if (isPollingRef.current) { console.log('[TicketPolling] Already polling, ignoring start request'); return; } console.log('[TicketPolling] Starting ticket polling...'); isPollingRef.current = true; scheduleNextPoll(); }, [enabled, scheduleNextPoll]); /** * Stop polling */ const stopPolling = useCallback(() => { console.log('[TicketPolling] Stopping ticket polling...'); isPollingRef.current = false; nextPollAtRef.current = null; if (timerRef.current) { clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } }, []); /** * Handle app state changes */ const handleAppStateChange = useCallback( (nextAppState: AppStateStatus) => { const previousState = appStateRef.current; appStateRef.current = nextAppState; console.log( '[TicketPolling] App state change:', previousState, '->', nextAppState ); if ( nextAppState === 'active' && (previousState === 'background' || previousState === 'inactive') ) { // App came to foreground if (enabled && !isPollingRef.current) { console.log('[TicketPolling] App foregrounded, resuming polling...'); // Wait 5 seconds then resume polling setTimeout(() => { if (appStateRef.current === 'active') { startPolling(); } }, 5000); } } else if ( (nextAppState === 'background' || nextAppState === 'inactive') && isPollingRef.current ) { // App went to background console.log('[TicketPolling] App backgrounded, pausing polling...'); stopPolling(); } }, [enabled, startPolling, stopPolling] ); /** * Setup app state listener */ useEffect(() => { const subscription = AppState.addEventListener( 'change', handleAppStateChange ); return () => { subscription?.remove(); }; }, [handleAppStateChange]); /** * Cleanup on unmount - FORCE stop all timers */ useEffect(() => { return () => { console.log('[TicketPolling] Cleaning up on unmount - FORCE STOP'); isPollingRef.current = false; nextPollAtRef.current = null; if (timerRef.current) { clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } }; }, []); return useMemo( () => ({ isPolling: isPollingRef.current, lastPollAt: lastPollAtRef.current, nextPollAt: nextPollAtRef.current, pollCount: pollCountRef.current, startPolling, stopPolling, pollNow, }), [startPolling, stopPolling, pollNow] ); }

Hook for automatic ticket polling

Integrates with existing refresh infrastructure and handles:

  • 30s + jitter polling intervals
  • Background/foreground app state transitions
  • Screen focus/blur detection
  • Proper cleanup on unmount
  • Debounce respect through existing refresh system

src/utils/kycValidation.ts

ALLOWED_KYC_MIME_TYPES
Default value : [ 'image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'application/pdf', ] as const

Allowed MIME types for KYC documents
MAX_KYC_DOCUMENTS
Type : number
Default value : 7

Maximum number of KYC documents allowed per lead

src/components/forms/DocumentPickerModal.tsx

ALLOWED_MIME_TYPES
Type : []
Default value : ['image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'application/pdf']

Allowed MIME types for validation
DocumentPickerModal
Type : React.FC<DocumentPickerModalProps>
Default value : ({ visible, onClose, onFilePicked, testID = 'document-picker-modal', }) => { const theme = useAppTheme(); const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null); const [isProcessing, setIsProcessing] = useState(false); /** * Clear error when modal visibility changes */ React.useEffect(() => { if (visible) { setError(null); } }, [visible]); /** * Validate selected file */ const validateFile = useCallback((file: RNFile): boolean => { try { // Validate MIME type validateMimeType(file.type); // Validate file size if (file.size > MAX_FILE_SIZE) { throw new ValidationError( 'File size must be less than 10MB', 'FILE_SIZE_EXCEEDED', 'fileSize', file.size ); } return true; } catch (validationError) { if (validationError instanceof ValidationError) { setError(validationError.message); } else { setError('File validation failed. Please try another file.'); } return false; } }, []); /** * Process selected file and validate */ const processSelectedFile = useCallback( (file: RNFile) => { setIsProcessing(true); try { if (validateFile(file)) { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] File validated successfully:', { name: file.name, type: file.type, size: file.size, }); onFilePicked(file); onClose(); } } catch (error) { console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] File processing error:', error); setError('Failed to process selected file. Please try again.'); } finally { setIsProcessing(false); } }, [validateFile, onFilePicked, onClose] ); /** * Handle gallery selection */ const handleGalleryPick = useCallback(() => { setError(null); const options: ImageLibraryOptions = { mediaType: 'photo' as MediaType, quality: 1, includeBase64: false, }; console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Opening gallery...'); launchImageLibrary(options, (response: ImagePickerResponse) => { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Gallery response:', response); if (response.didCancel) { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Gallery selection cancelled'); return; } if (response.errorMessage) { console.error( '[DocumentPickerModal] Gallery error:', response.errorMessage ); setError('Failed to select image from gallery. Please try again.'); return; } const asset = response.assets?.[0]; if (!asset || !asset.uri) { console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] No asset or URI found'); setError('Failed to get image from gallery. Please try again.'); return; } console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Gallery asset:', asset); const file: RNFile = { uri: asset.uri, name: asset.fileName || `image_${Date.now()}.jpg`, type: asset.type || 'image/jpeg', size: asset.fileSize || 0, }; processSelectedFile(file); }); }, [processSelectedFile]); /** * Handle camera capture */ const handleCameraCapture = useCallback(async () => { setError(null); console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Opening camera...'); // Request camera permission on Android if (Platform.OS === 'android') { try { // Check if permission is already granted const hasPermission = await PermissionsAndroid.check( PermissionsAndroid.PERMISSIONS.CAMERA ); if (!hasPermission) { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Requesting camera permission...'); const granted = await PermissionsAndroid.request( PermissionsAndroid.PERMISSIONS.CAMERA, { title: 'Camera Permission', message: 'This app needs access to camera to take photos for KYC documents.', buttonNeutral: 'Ask Me Later', buttonNegative: 'Cancel', buttonPositive: 'OK', } ); console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Permission result:', granted); if (granted !== PermissionsAndroid.RESULTS.GRANTED) { setError('Camera permission is required to take photos.'); return; } } } catch (error) { console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] Camera permission error:', error); setError('Failed to request camera permission.'); return; } } const options: CameraOptions = { mediaType: 'photo' as MediaType, quality: 1, includeBase64: false, }; launchCamera(options, (response: ImagePickerResponse) => { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Camera response:', response); if (response.didCancel) { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Camera capture cancelled'); return; } if (response.errorMessage) { console.error( '[DocumentPickerModal] Camera error:', response.errorMessage ); setError('Failed to capture photo. Please try again.'); return; } const asset = response.assets?.[0]; if (!asset || !asset.uri) { console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] No asset or URI found'); setError('Failed to capture photo. Please try again.'); return; } console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Camera asset:', asset); const file: RNFile = { uri: asset.uri, name: asset.fileName || `photo_${Date.now()}.jpg`, type: asset.type || 'image/jpeg', size: asset.fileSize || 0, }; processSelectedFile(file); }); }, [processSelectedFile]); /** * Handle file browser selection */ const handleFileBrowse = useCallback(async () => { setError(null); try { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Opening file browser...'); // Add more detailed logging console.log( '[DocumentPickerModal] DocumentPicker object:', DocumentPicker ); console.log( '[DocumentPickerModal] Attempting to pick file with options:', { type: ['image/*', 'application/pdf'], allowMultiSelection: false, } ); const results = await DocumentPicker.pick({ type: ['image/*', 'application/pdf'], allowMultiSelection: false, }).catch(e => { // Add catch block to the promise itself console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] Pick promise rejected:', e); throw e; }); console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] Pick succeeded, results:', results); const result = results[0]; console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] First result:', result); const file: RNFile = { uri: result.uri, name: result.name || 'document', type: result.type || 'application/octet-stream', size: result.size || 0, }; processSelectedFile(file); } catch (err) { // Type the error properly const error = err as {code?: string; message?: string}; console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] Detailed error:', { error, code: error.code, message: error.message, stack: (error as Error).stack, }); if (error.code === 'DOCUMENT_PICKER_CANCELED') { console.log('[DocumentPickerModal] File selection cancelled'); return; } console.error('[DocumentPickerModal] File browser error:', error); setError('Failed to select file. Please try again.'); } }, [processSelectedFile]); /** * Clear error message */ const clearError = useCallback(() => { setError(null); }, []); return ( <Portal> <Modal visible={visible} onDismiss={onClose} contentContainerStyle={styles.modalContainer} testID={testID} > <Card style={[styles.card, {backgroundColor: theme.colors.surface}]}> <Card.Content> <Text variant="headlineSmall" style={[styles.title, {color: theme.colors.onSurface}]} accessibilityRole="header" accessibilityLabel="Select document source" > Select Document </Text> <Text variant="bodyMedium" style={[styles.subtitle, {color: theme.colors.onSurfaceVariant}]} > Choose how you'd like to add your document </Text> {error && ( <ErrorMessage message={error} type="error" visible={true} dismissible={true} onDismiss={clearError} style={styles.errorMessage} testID="document-picker-error" /> )} <View style={styles.optionsContainer}> <Button mode="outlined" onPress={handleGalleryPick} disabled={isProcessing} style={styles.optionButton} contentStyle={styles.buttonContent} labelStyle={[styles.buttonLabel, {color: theme.colors.primary}]} icon={({size, color}) => ( <MaterialIcons name="photo-library" size={size} color={color} /> )} accessibilityLabel="Select image from gallery" accessibilityRole="button" accessibilityHint="Opens your photo gallery to select an image" testID="gallery-button" > Gallery </Button> <Button mode="outlined" onPress={handleCameraCapture} disabled={isProcessing} style={styles.optionButton} contentStyle={styles.buttonContent} labelStyle={[styles.buttonLabel, {color: theme.colors.primary}]} icon={({size, color}) => ( <MaterialIcons name="camera-alt" size={size} color={color} /> )} accessibilityLabel="Take photo with camera" accessibilityRole="button" accessibilityHint="Opens camera to take a new photo" testID="camera-button" > Camera </Button> <Button mode="outlined" onPress={handleFileBrowse} disabled={isProcessing} style={styles.optionButton} contentStyle={styles.buttonContent} labelStyle={[styles.buttonLabel, {color: theme.colors.primary}]} icon={({size, color}) => ( <MaterialIcons name="folder-open" size={size} color={color} /> )} accessibilityLabel="Browse files" accessibilityRole="button" accessibilityHint="Opens file browser to select a document" testID="browse-button" > Browse Files </Button> </View> <Divider style={styles.divider} /> <Text variant="bodySmall" style={[styles.helpText, {color: theme.colors.onSurfaceVariant}]} > Supported formats: JPG, PNG, PDF{'\n'} Maximum file size: 10MB </Text> </Card.Content> <Card.Actions style={styles.actions}> <Button mode="text" onPress={onClose} disabled={isProcessing} accessibilityLabel="Cancel document selection" accessibilityRole="button" testID="cancel-button" > Cancel </Button> </Card.Actions> </Card> </Modal> </Portal> ); }

Default value : 10 * 1024 * 1024

Maximum file size (10MB in bytes)

src/components/feedback/LoadingOverlay.tsx

allStyles

LoadingOverlay
Type : React.FC<LoadingOverlayProps>
Default value : ({ visible, message, transparent = false, size = 'large', color, }) => { const theme = useAppTheme(); const spinnerColor = color || theme.colors.primary; if (!visible) { return null; } return ( <Modal transparent animationType="fade" visible={visible} statusBarTranslucent > <View style={[ styles.overlay, { backgroundColor: transparent ? `${theme.colors.background}80` // 50% opacity : `${theme.colors.background}E6`, // 90% opacity }, ]} > <View style={[ styles.container, { backgroundColor: theme.colors.surface, ...theme.shadows.medium, }, ]} > <ActivityIndicator size={size} color={spinnerColor} style={styles.spinner} /> {message && ( <Text style={[ styles.message, { color: theme.colors.onSurface, fontSize: theme.typography.fontSize.sm, fontFamily: theme.typography.fontFamily.medium, }, ]} > {message} </Text> )} </View> </View> </Modal> ); }

Loading Overlay Component Shows a loading spinner with optional message over the current screen
PersistenceLoadingOverlay
Type : React.FC<PersistenceLoadingProps>
Default value : ({ visible, stage, progress, }) => { const theme = useAppTheme(); const getStageMessage = () => { switch (stage) { case 'initializing': return 'Initializing app...'; case 'rehydrating': return 'Restoring your data...'; case 'migrating': return 'Updating app data...'; case 'complete': return 'Ready!'; default: return 'Loading...'; } }; const getStageIcon = () => { switch (stage) { case 'initializing': return '🚀'; case 'rehydrating': return '💾'; case 'migrating': return '🔄'; case 'complete': return '✅'; default: return '⏳'; } }; if (!visible) { return null; } return ( <Modal transparent animationType="fade" visible={visible} statusBarTranslucent > <View style={[ styles.overlay, {backgroundColor: `${theme.colors.background}F0`}, // 94% opacity ]} > <View style={[ styles.container, { backgroundColor: theme.colors.surface, ...theme.shadows.large, }, ]} > {/* Stage Icon */} <Text style={styles.stageIcon}>{getStageIcon()}</Text> {/* Loading Spinner */} <ActivityIndicator size="large" color={theme.colors.primary} style={styles.spinner} /> {/* Stage Message */} <Text style={[ styles.message, { color: theme.colors.onSurface, fontSize: theme.typography.fontSize.md, fontFamily: theme.typography.fontFamily.medium, }, ]} > {getStageMessage()} </Text> {/* Progress Bar */} {progress !== undefined && ( <View style={[ styles.progressContainer, {backgroundColor: theme.colors.outline}, ]} > <View style={[ styles.progressBar, { backgroundColor: theme.colors.primary, width: `${Math.max(0, Math.min(100, progress))}%`, }, ]} /> </View> )} {/* Progress Text */} {progress !== undefined && ( <Text style={[ styles.progressText, { color: theme.colors.onSurfaceVariant, fontSize: theme.typography.fontSize.sm, }, ]} > {Math.round(progress)}% </Text> )} </View> </View> </Modal> ); }

Persistence Loading Overlay Component Specialized loading overlay for Redux persistence operations

Default value : StyleSheet.create({ // stageIcon: { // fontSize: 32, // marginBottom: 16, // }, // progressContainer: { // width: '100%', // height: 4, // borderRadius: 2, // marginTop: 16, // overflow: 'hidden', // }, // progressBar: { // height: '100%', // borderRadius: 2, // }, // progressText: { // marginTop: 8, // textAlign: 'center', // }, })
styles

src/utils/storageHelpers.ts

API_CACHE_KEYS
Default value : { SERVICES: 'api_cache_services', SERVICE_CATEGORIES: 'api_cache_service_categories', USER_LEADS: 'api_cache_user_leads', OFFLINE_QUEUE: 'api_offline_queue', } as const
backupStorage
Default value : async (): Promise<Record<string, any>> => { try { const backup: Record<string, any> = {}; // Get all known keys const keys = Object.values(STORAGE_KEYS); for (const key of keys) { const value = await getStorageItem(key); if (value !== null) { backup[key] = value; } } return backup; } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Backup failed:', error); throw error; } }

Backup current storage to a JSON object
clearAllApiCache
Default value : async (): Promise<void> => { try { const cacheKeys = Object.values(API_CACHE_KEYS); await Promise.all(cacheKeys.map(key => removeStorageItem(key))); console.log('[Storage] Cleared all API cache'); } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Error clearing API cache:', error); } }

Clear all API cache
clearExpiredApiCache
Default value : async (): Promise<void> => { try { const cacheKeys = Object.values(API_CACHE_KEYS); const now = Date.now(); for (const key of cacheKeys) { const cacheItem = await getStorageItem<{ timestamp: number; ttl: number; }>(key); if (cacheItem && now - cacheItem.timestamp > cacheItem.ttl) { await removeStorageItem(key); console.log(`[Storage] Cleared expired cache: ${key}`); } } } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Error clearing expired cache:', error); } }

Clear expired API cache
clearOfflineRequestsQueue
Default value : async (): Promise<void> => { try { await removeStorageItem(API_CACHE_KEYS.OFFLINE_QUEUE); } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Error clearing offline queue:', error); } }

Clear offline requests queue
clearStorage
Default value : async (): Promise<void> => { try { await EncryptedStorage.clear(); console.log('[Storage] Successfully cleared all storage'); } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Error clearing storage:', error); throw new Error('Failed to clear storage'); } }

Clear all storage
getApiCache
Default value : async <T = any>(key: string): Promise<T | null> => { try { const cacheItem = await getStorageItem<{ data: T; timestamp: number; ttl: number; }>(key); if (!cacheItem) { return null; } // Check if cache is expired const now = Date.now(); if (now - cacheItem.timestamp > cacheItem.ttl) { console.log(`[Storage] Cache expired for ${key}`); await removeStorageItem(key); return null; } return cacheItem.data; } catch (error) { console.error(`[Storage] Error getting API cache ${key}:`, error); return null; } }

Get API cache data
getAuthToken
Use secureStorage directly
Default value : async (): Promise<string | null> => { console.warn( '[StorageHelpers] getAuthToken is deprecated. Use secureStorage.getJWT instead' ); try { const {getJWT} = await import('../storage/secureStorage'); const token = await getJWT(); return token || null; } catch (error) { console.error( '[StorageHelpers] Failed to get auth token via secure storage:', error ); return null; } }

Backward compatibility proxy for AUTH_TOKEN operations
getMultipleStorageItems
Default value : async <T = any>( keys: string[] ): Promise<Record<string, T | null>> => { const result: Record<string, T | null> = {}; await Promise.all( keys.map(async key => { result[key] = await getStorageItem<T>(key); }) ); return result; }

Get multiple storage items at once
getOfflineRequestsQueue
Default value : async (): Promise<any[]> => { try { return (await getStorageItem<any[]>(API_CACHE_KEYS.OFFLINE_QUEUE)) || []; } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Error getting offline queue:', error); return []; } }

Get offline requests queue
getStorageInfo
Default value : async (): Promise<{ available: boolean; quota?: number; usage?: number; }> => { try { // Test if storage is available const testKey = 'storage_test'; const testValue = 'test'; await setStorageItem(testKey, testValue); const retrieved = await getStorageItem(testKey); await removeStorageItem(testKey); return { available: retrieved === testValue, // Note: React Native doesn't provide quota info quota: undefined, usage: undefined, }; } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Storage info check failed:', error); return {available: false}; } }

Persistence-specific storage operations
getStorageItem
Default value : async <T = any>( key: string ): Promise<T | null> => { try { const jsonValue = await EncryptedStorage.getItem(key); if (jsonValue === null) { console.log(`[Storage] No value found for ${key}`); return null; } const parsedValue = JSON.parse(jsonValue); console.log(`[Storage] Successfully retrieved ${key}`); return parsedValue; } catch (error) { console.error(`[Storage] Error getting ${key}:`, error); return null; // Return null instead of throwing to prevent app crashes } }

Get item from encrypted storage
hasStorageItem
Default value : async (key: string): Promise<boolean> => { try { const value = await EncryptedStorage.getItem(key); return value !== null; } catch (error) { console.error(`[Storage] Error checking ${key}:`, error); return false; } }

Check if storage item exists
LEGACY_AUTH_TOKEN_KEY
Use secureStorage.saveJWT/getJWT/clearJWT instead This is kept for backward compatibility only
Default value : STORAGE_KEYS.AUTH_TOKEN
migrateStorage
Default value : async ( fromVersion: number, toVersion: number, migrationFn: (data: any) => any ): Promise<void> => { try { console.log( `[Storage] Migrating from version ${fromVersion} to ${toVersion}` ); // Backup current data const backup = await backupStorage(); // Apply migration const migratedData = migrationFn(backup); // Clear current storage await clearStorage(); // Restore migrated data await restoreStorage(migratedData); console.log('[Storage] Migration completed successfully'); } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Migration failed:', error); throw error; } }

Migrate storage data
removeAuthToken
Use secureStorage directly
Default value : async (): Promise<void> => { console.warn( '[StorageHelpers] removeAuthToken is deprecated. Use secureStorage.clearJWT instead' ); try { const {clearJWT} = await import('../storage/secureStorage'); await clearJWT(); } catch (error) { console.error( '[StorageHelpers] Failed to remove auth token via secure storage:', error ); throw error; } }

Backward compatibility proxy for AUTH_TOKEN operations
removeStorageItem
Default value : async (key: string): Promise<void> => { try { await EncryptedStorage.removeItem(key); console.log(`[Storage] Successfully removed ${key}`); } catch (error) { console.error(`[Storage] Error removing ${key}:`, error); throw new Error(`Failed to remove ${key} from storage`); } }

Remove item from encrypted storage
restoreStorage
Default value : async ( backup: Record<string, any> ): Promise<void> => { try { for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(backup)) { if (value !== null) { await setStorageItem(key, value); } } } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Restore failed:', error); throw error; } }

Restore storage from backup
setApiCache
Default value : async ( key: string, data: any, ttl?: number ): Promise<void> => { try { const cacheItem = { data, timestamp: Date.now(), ttl: ttl || 5 * 60 * 1000, // Default 5 minutes }; await setStorageItem(key, cacheItem); } catch (error) { console.error(`[Storage] Error setting API cache ${key}:`, error); } }

Store API cache data
setAuthToken
Use secureStorage directly
Default value : async (token: string): Promise<void> => { console.warn( '[StorageHelpers] setAuthToken is deprecated. Use secureStorage.saveJWT instead' ); try { const {saveJWT} = await import('../storage/secureStorage'); await saveJWT(token); } catch (error) { console.error( '[StorageHelpers] Failed to save auth token via secure storage:', error ); throw error; } }

Backward compatibility proxy for AUTH_TOKEN operations
setMultipleStorageItems
Default value : async ( items: Record<string, any> ): Promise<void> => { const promises = Object.entries(items).map(([key, value]) => setStorageItem(key, value) ); await Promise.all(promises); }

Set multiple storage items at once
setStorageItem
Default value : async ( key: string, value: any ): Promise<void> => { try { const jsonValue = JSON.stringify(value); await EncryptedStorage.setItem(key, jsonValue); console.log(`[Storage] Successfully set ${key}`); } catch (error) { console.error(`[Storage] Error setting ${key}:`, error); throw new Error(`Failed to save ${key} to storage`); } }

Set item in encrypted storage
STORAGE_KEYS
Default value : { AUTH_TOKEN: 'auth_token', USER_DATA: 'user_data', NAVIGATION_STATE: 'navigation_state', CACHE_DATA: 'cache_data', } as const

Storage keys constants
storeOfflineRequest
Default value : async (request: { endpoint: string; method: string; body?: any; timestamp: number; }): Promise<void> => { try { const queue = (await getStorageItem<(typeof request)[]>( API_CACHE_KEYS.OFFLINE_QUEUE )) || []; queue.push(request); await setStorageItem(API_CACHE_KEYS.OFFLINE_QUEUE, queue); } catch (error) { console.error('[Storage] Error storing offline request:', error); } }

Store offline API request

src/App.tsx

App
Type : React.FC
Default value : () => { return ( <Provider store={store}> <PersistGate loading={ <LoadingOverlayContainer visible={true} message="Loading..." /> } persistor={persistor} > <ThemeProvider> <AppStateManager> <AuthRestoreManager> <NewRootNavigator /> </AuthRestoreManager> </AppStateManager> </ThemeProvider> </PersistGate> </Provider> ); }

Complete New App Component
AppStateManager
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({children}) => { const [appState, setAppState] = useState<AppStateStatus>( AppState.currentState ); /** * Handle app state changes */ useEffect(() => { const handleAppStateChange = async (nextAppState: AppStateStatus) => { console.log('[App] App state changed:', appState, '->', nextAppState); if (appState.match(/inactive|background/) && nextAppState === 'active') { // App came to foreground console.log('[App] App came to foreground'); } else if (nextAppState.match(/inactive|background/)) { // App went to background console.log('[App] App went to background'); } setAppState(nextAppState); }; const subscription = AppState.addEventListener( 'change', handleAppStateChange ); return () => subscription?.remove(); }, [appState]); return <>{children}</>; }

App State Manager Component Handles app state changes and persistence
AuthRestoreManager
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({ children, }) => { const [authRestoreComplete, setAuthRestoreComplete] = useState(false); const {isLoading} = useNewAuth(); // Monitor auth loading state to determine when restoration is complete useEffect(() => { if (!isLoading && !authRestoreComplete) { console.log('[App] Auth restoration completed'); setAuthRestoreComplete(true); // Debug auth state after restoration if (__DEV__) { setTimeout(() => { debugAuthState(); }, 1000); } } }, [isLoading, authRestoreComplete]); return ( <NotificationPollingManager authRestoreComplete={authRestoreComplete}> {children} </NotificationPollingManager> ); }

Auth Restoration Manager Component Handles authentication state restoration coordination
NotificationPollingManager
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({children, authRestoreComplete}) => { const isLoggedIn = useNewAppSelector(selectIsLoggedIn); const token = useNewAppSelector(state => state.newAuth?.token); // Initialize polling hook const {isPolling, pollCount, startPolling, stopPolling} = useNotificationPolling({ baseIntervalSeconds: 30, maxJitterSeconds: 5, enabled: true, startImmediately: false, // We'll control start/stop based on auth state }); /** * Check if we have all requirements to start polling */ const canStartPolling = useCallback(() => { const hasToken = !!token; const isAuthenticated = isLoggedIn && authRestoreComplete; console.log('[App] Polling readiness check:', { isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, hasToken, isAuthenticated, canStart: isAuthenticated && hasToken, }); return isAuthenticated && hasToken; }, [isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, token]); /** * Start polling with token availability check */ const startPollingWithTokenCheck = useCallback(() => { if (canStartPolling()) { console.log( '[App] All requirements met, starting notification polling...' ); startPolling(); } else { console.log('[App] Requirements not met yet, will retry in 1 second...'); // Retry after 1 second if token is not available yet setTimeout(() => { if (canStartPolling()) { console.log( '[App] Token now available, starting notification polling...' ); startPolling(); } else { console.log( '[App] Token still not available after retry, skipping polling start' ); } }, 1000); } }, [canStartPolling, startPolling]); /** * Handle authentication state changes */ useEffect(() => { console.log( '[App] Auth state changed - isLoggedIn:', isLoggedIn, 'authRestoreComplete:', authRestoreComplete, 'hasToken:', !!token ); if (isLoggedIn && authRestoreComplete) { // Small delay to ensure Redux state is fully updated, then check token setTimeout(() => { startPollingWithTokenCheck(); }, 2000); } else { console.log( '[App] User logged out or auth restoring, stopping notification polling...' ); stopPolling(); } }, [ isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, token, startPollingWithTokenCheck, stopPolling, ]); /** * Debug polling status (development only) */ useEffect(() => { if (__DEV__) { console.log('[App] Polling status:', { isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, isPolling, pollCount, }); } }, [isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, isPolling, pollCount]); return <>{children}</>; }

Notification Polling Manager Component Handles automatic notification polling based on authentication state Includes token availability check to prevent race conditions

src/config/environments.ts

AppConfig
Default value : getAppConfig()

Export the current configuration
environments
Type : Record<Environment, AppConfig>
Default value : { development: { BASE_API_URL: 'https://truereach-production.up.railway.app', APP_ENV: 'development', API_TIMEOUT: 10000, DEBUG_MODE: true, API_CONFIG: { timeout: 10000, retries: 3, retryDelay: 1000, enableLogging: true, enableOfflineCache: true, }, }, staging: { BASE_API_URL: 'https://truereach-production.up.railway.app', APP_ENV: 'staging', API_TIMEOUT: 10000, DEBUG_MODE: true, API_CONFIG: { timeout: 10000, retries: 3, retryDelay: 1000, enableLogging: true, enableOfflineCache: true, }, }, production: { BASE_API_URL: 'https://truereach-production.up.railway.app', APP_ENV: 'production', API_TIMEOUT: 8000, DEBUG_MODE: false, API_CONFIG: { timeout: 8000, retries: 3, retryDelay: 2000, enableLogging: false, enableOfflineCache: false, }, }, }

Environment configurations In a real app, these would come from build-time variables For now, we'll determine environment based on DEV flag
getApiBaseUrl
Default value : (): string => AppConfig.BASE_API_URL

Utility function to get API base URL
getApiConfig
Default value : (): ApiConfig => AppConfig.API_CONFIG

Get API configuration
getAppConfig
Default value : (): AppConfig => { const currentEnv = getCurrentEnvironment(); const config = environments[currentEnv]; // Log configuration for debugging (only in debug mode) if (config.DEBUG_MODE) { console.log(`[Environment] Current: ${currentEnv}`); console.log('[Environment] Config:', config); } return config; }

Get current app configuration
getCurrentEnvironment
Default value : (): Environment => { // For now, use __DEV__ to determine environment // In production builds, __DEV__ will be false if (__DEV__) { return 'development'; } // In a real deployment, you might check other indicators // like bundle ID, build configuration, etc. return 'production'; }

Determine current environment Uses DEV flag to determine if we're in development In the future, this can be enhanced with build-time environment detection
isApiLoggingEnabled
Default value : (): boolean => AppConfig.API_CONFIG.enableLogging

Check if API logging is enabled
isDevelopment
Default value : (): boolean => AppConfig.APP_ENV === 'development'

Utility function to check if we're in development
isOfflineCacheEnabled
Default value : (): boolean => AppConfig.API_CONFIG.enableOfflineCache

Check if offline cache is enabled
isProduction
Default value : (): boolean => AppConfig.APP_ENV === 'production'

Utility function to check if we're in production

src/NewAppComplete.tsx

AppStateManager
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({children}) => { const [appState, setAppState] = useState<AppStateStatus>( AppState.currentState ); /** * Handle app state changes */ useEffect(() => { const handleAppStateChange = async (nextAppState: AppStateStatus) => { console.log('[App] App state changed:', appState, '->', nextAppState); if (appState.match(/inactive|background/) && nextAppState === 'active') { // App came to foreground console.log('[App] App came to foreground'); } else if (nextAppState.match(/inactive|background/)) { // App went to background console.log('[App] App went to background'); } setAppState(nextAppState); }; const subscription = AppState.addEventListener( 'change', handleAppStateChange ); return () => subscription?.remove(); }, [appState]); return <>{children}</>; }

App State Manager Component Handles app state changes and persistence
AuthRestoreManager
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({ children, }) => { const [authRestoreComplete, setAuthRestoreComplete] = useState(false); const {isLoading} = useNewAuth(); // Monitor auth loading state to determine when restoration is complete useEffect(() => { if (!isLoading && !authRestoreComplete) { console.log('[App] Auth restoration completed'); setAuthRestoreComplete(true); // Debug auth state after restoration if (__DEV__) { setTimeout(() => { debugAuthState(); }, 1000); } } }, [isLoading, authRestoreComplete]); return ( <NotificationPollingManager authRestoreComplete={authRestoreComplete}> {children} </NotificationPollingManager> ); }

Auth Restoration Manager Component Handles authentication state restoration coordination
NewAppComplete
Type : React.FC
Default value : () => { return ( <Provider store={store}> <PersistGate loading={ <LoadingOverlayContainer visible={true} message="Loading..." /> } persistor={persistor} > <ThemeProvider> <AppStateManager> <AuthRestoreManager> <NewRootNavigator /> </AuthRestoreManager> </AppStateManager> </ThemeProvider> </PersistGate> </Provider> ); }

Complete New App Component
NotificationPollingManager
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({children, authRestoreComplete}) => { const isLoggedIn = useNewAppSelector(selectIsLoggedIn); const token = useNewAppSelector(state => state.newAuth?.token); // Initialize polling hook const {isPolling, pollCount, startPolling, stopPolling} = useNotificationPolling({ baseIntervalSeconds: 30, maxJitterSeconds: 5, enabled: true, startImmediately: false, // We'll control start/stop based on auth state }); /** * Check if we have all requirements to start polling */ const canStartPolling = useCallback(() => { const hasToken = !!token; const isAuthenticated = isLoggedIn && authRestoreComplete; console.log('[App] Polling readiness check:', { isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, hasToken, isAuthenticated, canStart: isAuthenticated && hasToken, }); return isAuthenticated && hasToken; }, [isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, token]); /** * Start polling with token availability check */ const startPollingWithTokenCheck = useCallback(() => { if (canStartPolling()) { console.log( '[App] All requirements met, starting notification polling...' ); startPolling(); } else { console.log('[App] Requirements not met yet, will retry in 1 second...'); // Retry after 1 second if token is not available yet setTimeout(() => { if (canStartPolling()) { console.log( '[App] Token now available, starting notification polling...' ); startPolling(); } else { console.log( '[App] Token still not available after retry, skipping polling start' ); } }, 1000); } }, [canStartPolling, startPolling]); /** * Handle authentication state changes */ useEffect(() => { console.log( '[App] Auth state changed - isLoggedIn:', isLoggedIn, 'authRestoreComplete:', authRestoreComplete, 'hasToken:', !!token ); if (isLoggedIn && authRestoreComplete) { // Small delay to ensure Redux state is fully updated, then check token setTimeout(() => { startPollingWithTokenCheck(); }, 2000); } else { console.log( '[App] User logged out or auth restoring, stopping notification polling...' ); stopPolling(); } }, [ isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, token, startPollingWithTokenCheck, stopPolling, ]); /** * Debug polling status (development only) */ useEffect(() => { if (__DEV__) { console.log('[App] Polling status:', { isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, isPolling, pollCount, }); } }, [isLoggedIn, authRestoreComplete, isPolling, pollCount]); return <>{children}</>; }

Notification Polling Manager Component Handles automatic notification polling based on authentication state Includes token availability check to prevent race conditions

expectLoadingState
Default value : ( getByTestId: any, testId: string, isLoading: boolean ) => { if (isLoading) { expect(getByTestId(testId)).toBeTruthy(); } else { expect(() => getByTestId(testId)).toThrow(); } }

measurePerformance
Default value : async (testFn: () => Promise<void>) => { const start = performance.now(); await testFn(); const end = performance.now(); return end - start; }

Performance testing helper
mockApiResponse
Default value : <T extends unknown>( data: T, success = true ) => ({ success, data: success ? data : null, error: success ? null : {code: 400, message: 'Test error'}, })

renderWithProviders
Default value : ( ui: ReactElement, { preloadedState, store = setupTestStore(preloadedState), withNavigation = false, withPersistence = false, ...renderOptions }: ExtendedRenderOptions = {} ) => { const Wrapper = ({children}: {children: React.ReactNode}) => ( <TestWrapper store={store} withNavigation={withNavigation} withPersistence={withPersistence} > {children} </TestWrapper> ); return { store, ...render(ui, {wrapper: Wrapper, ...renderOptions}), }; }

Custom render function with providers
setupTestStore
Default value : (preloadedState?: Partial<RootState>) => { return configureStore({ reducer: { auth: authReducer, ui: uiReducer, cache: cacheReducer, [authApi.reducerPath]: authApi.reducer, [servicesApi.reducerPath]: servicesApi.reducer, [leadsApi.reducerPath]: leadsApi.reducer, }, middleware: getDefaultMiddleware => getDefaultMiddleware({ serializableCheck: false, // Disable for testing }) .concat(authApi.middleware) .concat(servicesApi.middleware) .concat(leadsApi.middleware), preloadedState, }); }

TestWrapper

Default value : ({ children, store, withNavigation, withPersistence, }) => { const persistor = withPersistence ? persistStore(store) : null; const content = withNavigation ? ( <NavigationContainer>{children}</NavigationContainer> ) : ( children ); return ( <Provider store={store}> {withPersistence && persistor ? ( <PersistGate loading={<LoadingOverlay visible={true} />} persistor={persistor} > <ThemeProvider>{content}</ThemeProvider> </PersistGate> ) : ( <ThemeProvider>{content}</ThemeProvider> )} </Provider> ); }

src/types/Auth.ts

AUTH_CONSTANTS
Default value : { MAX_OTP_ATTEMPTS: 5, LOCKOUT_DURATION_MS: 15 * 60 * 1000, // 15 minutes RESEND_COOLDOWN_MS: 60 * 1000, // 60 seconds OTP_VALIDITY_MS: 5 * 60 * 1000, // 5 minutes } as const

Constants

src/api/endpoints/auth.ts

authApi
Default value : createApi({ reducerPath: 'authApi', baseQuery, tagTypes: ['Auth', 'User'], endpoints: builder => ({ /** * Login with phone/OTP - calls real mock server */ login: builder.mutation<AuthResponse, {phone?: string; otp?: string}>({ query: credentials => ({ url: '/auth/login', method: 'POST', body: credentials, headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', }, }), transformResponse: (response: any) => { // Handle the actual API response format: {accessToken, user: {id, name, email, phone, role}} if (response.accessToken && response.user) { return { user: { id: response.user.id, phone: response.user.phone, name: response.user.name, email: response.user.email, role: response.user.role, }, token: response.accessToken, refreshToken: response.accessToken, // Single token for now expiresIn: 86400, // 24 hours default }; } // Fallback for other formats if (response.success && response.data) { return { user: { id: response.data.userId, phone: '', // Will be filled from login form name: 'Customer', // Mock server doesn't return name email: '', role: response.data.role, }, token: response.data.token, refreshToken: response.data.token, // Mock server doesn't have separate refresh token expiresIn: 86400, // 24 hours default }; } throw new Error(response.error || 'Login failed'); }, transformErrorResponse: transformAuthError, invalidatesTags: ['User', 'Auth'], }), }), })

Authentication API using real mock server
transformAuthError
Default value : (error: any) => { // Create basic error structure const baseError = { code: error.status || 500, message: error.data?.message || error.statusText || 'Authentication failed', type: AuthError.NETWORK_ERROR, }; // Map HTTP status codes to AuthError types if (error.status === 401) { return { ...baseError, type: AuthError.INVALID_OTP, message: 'Invalid OTP provided', }; } if (error.status === 423) { return { ...baseError, type: AuthError.LOCKED_OUT, message: 'Account temporarily locked', }; } if (error.status === 400) { return { ...baseError, type: AuthError.INVALID_PHONE, message: 'Invalid phone number', }; } if (error.status >= 500) { return { ...baseError, type: AuthError.SERVER_ERROR, message: 'Server error occurred', }; } return baseError; }

Transform authentication errors to include proper error types
Default value : authApi

src/NewApp.tsx

AuthInitializer
Type : React.FC<literal type>
Default value : ({children}) => { const hasInitializedRef = useRef(false); useEffect(() => { if (!hasInitializedRef.current) { console.log('[App] Starting auth restoration...'); hasInitializedRef.current = true; store.dispatch(restoreAuth()); } }, []); return <>{children}</>; }

Auth Initializer Component Handles one-time auth restoration
NewApp

New App Component

src/store/authSlice.ts

authSlice
Default value : createSlice({ name: 'auth', initialState, reducers: { // Manual loading control setLoading: (state, action: PayloadAction<boolean>) => { state.isLoading = action.payload; }, // Clear error clearError: state => { state.error = undefined; }, // Update user profile updateUserProfile: (state, action: PayloadAction<Partial<User>>) => { if (state.user) { state.user = {...state.user, ...action.payload}; } }, // Legacy actions for compatibility (keeping them for now) loginRequest: state => { state.isLoading = true; state.error = undefined; }, loginSuccess: ( state, action: PayloadAction<{ token: string; refreshToken?: string; user: User; }> ) => { state.isLoggedIn = true; state.isLoading = false; state.token = action.payload.token; state.refreshToken = action.payload.refreshToken; state.user = action.payload.user; state.lastLoginTime = Date.now(); state.error = undefined; }, loginFailure: (state, action: PayloadAction<string>) => { state.isLoggedIn = false; state.isLoading = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; state.error = action.payload; }, logout: state => { state.isLoggedIn = false; state.isLoading = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; state.lastLoginTime = undefined; state.error = undefined; }, }, extraReducers: builder => { // Send OTP builder .addCase(sendOtpThunk.pending, state => { state.isSendingOtp = true; state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(sendOtpThunk.fulfilled, state => { state.isSendingOtp = false; state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(sendOtpThunk.rejected, (state, action) => { state.isSendingOtp = false; state.error = action.payload as string; }) // Login .addCase(loginWithOtp.pending, state => { state.isLoading = true; state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(loginWithOtp.fulfilled, (state, action) => { state.isLoading = false; state.isLoggedIn = true; state.token = action.payload.token; // state.refreshToken = action.payload.refreshToken; state.user = action.payload.user; state.lastLoginTime = Date.now(); state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(loginWithOtp.rejected, (state, action) => { state.isLoading = false; state.isLoggedIn = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; state.error = action.payload as string; }) // Logout .addCase(logoutUser.pending, state => { state.isLoading = true; }) .addCase(logoutUser.fulfilled, state => { state.isLoading = false; state.isLoggedIn = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; state.lastLoginTime = undefined; state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(logoutUser.rejected, (state, action) => { state.isLoading = false; state.error = action.payload as string; }) // Refresh Token .addCase(refreshTokenThunk.pending, state => { state.isLoading = true; }) .addCase(refreshTokenThunk.fulfilled, (state, action) => { state.isLoading = false; state.token = action.payload.token; if (action.payload.refreshToken) { state.refreshToken = action.payload.refreshToken; } state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(refreshTokenThunk.rejected, (state, action) => { state.isLoading = false; // If refresh fails, consider logging out if (action.payload === 'No refresh token available') { state.isLoggedIn = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; } state.error = action.payload as string; }) .addCase(loginWithOtpEnhanced.pending, state => { state.isLoading = true; state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(loginWithOtpEnhanced.fulfilled, (state, action) => { state.isLoggedIn = true; state.isLoading = false; state.token = action.payload.token; state.refreshToken = action.payload.refreshToken; state.user = action.payload.user; state.lastLoginTime = Date.now(); state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(loginWithOtpEnhanced.rejected, (state, action) => { state.isLoggedIn = false; state.isLoading = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; state.error = action.payload as string; }) .addCase(logoutUserEnhanced.fulfilled, state => { state.isLoggedIn = false; state.isLoading = false; state.token = undefined; state.refreshToken = undefined; state.user = undefined; state.lastLoginTime = undefined; state.error = undefined; }) // Restore Auth State .addCase(restoreAuthState.pending, state => { // Don't set loading state for restoration to avoid UI flicker console.log('[Auth] Auth restoration pending: state - ', state); console.log('[Auth] Auth restoration in progress...'); }) .addCase(restoreAuthState.fulfilled, (state, action) => { // State changes are handled by the thunk itself via dispatch console.log('[Auth] Auth restoration completed:', action.payload); }) .addCase(restoreAuthState.rejected, (state, action) => { console.error('[Auth] Auth restoration failed:', action.payload); // Don't change auth state on restoration failure to be safe }) // Enhanced Login Success .addCase(loginSuccessEnhanced.pending, state => { state.isLoading = true; state.error = undefined; }) .addCase(loginSuccessEnhanced.fulfilled, (state, action) => { // State is already updated by the dispatched loginSuccess action state.isLoading = false; console.log('[Auth] Enhanced login success: action - ', action); console.log('[Auth] Enhanced login success completed'); }) .addCase(loginSuccessEnhanced.rejected, (state, action) => { state.isLoading = false; state.error = action.payload as string; console.error('[Auth] Enhanced login success failed:', action.payload); }); }, })

Auth slice
initialState
Type : AuthState
Default value : { isLoggedIn: false, isLoading: false, isSendingOtp: false, token: undefined, refreshToken: undefined, user: undefined, lastLoginTime: undefined, error: undefined, }

Initial state
loginSuccessEnhanced
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/loginSuccessEnhanced', async ( payload: { token: string; refreshToken?: string; user: User; }, {dispatch, rejectWithValue} ) => { try { console.log('[Auth] Processing enhanced login success...'); // First save JWT to secure storage await saveJWT(payload.token); console.log('[Auth] JWT saved to secure storage successfully'); // Then update Redux state dispatch(loginSuccess(payload)); return payload; } catch (error) { console.error('[Auth] Failed to save JWT during login:', error); if (error instanceof SecureStorageError) { // If secure storage fails, still complete login but warn console.warn('[Auth] Secure storage failed, completing login anyway'); dispatch(loginSuccess(payload)); // Set a UI warning about storage issues dispatch({ type: 'ui/setError', payload: 'Login successful but session may not persist. Please restart the app if you experience issues.', }); return payload; } // For other errors, fail the login return rejectWithValue('Failed to complete login process'); } } )

Enhanced login success action that saves to secure storage Use this instead of the direct loginSuccess action
loginWithOtp
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/loginWithOtp', async ( {phone, otp}: {phone: string; otp: string}, {dispatch, rejectWithValue} ) => { try { // Simulate API call - replace with real API in later tasks await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1500)); // Demo: Accept OTP 123456, reject others if (otp !== '123456') { throw new Error('Invalid OTP. Please try again.'); } const user: User = { id: `user_${Date.now()}`, phone, name: 'Demo User', email: 'demo@solarium.com', }; const token = `demo_token_${Date.now()}`; // Store in secure storage try { await saveJWT(token); console.log('[Auth] JWT token saved to secure storage'); } catch (storageError) { console.error('[Auth] Failed to save JWT token:', storageError); if (storageError instanceof SecureStorageError) { // Dispatch logout to clear any partial state dispatch(logout()); // Set user-visible error message dispatch({ type: 'ui/setError', payload: 'Unable to save login session. Please try again.', }); return rejectWithValue('Secure storage unavailable'); } // For other errors, continue but log warning console.warn( '[Auth] Non-critical storage error during login:', storageError ); } return {token, user}; } catch (error: any) { console.error('[Auth] Login failed:', error); return rejectWithValue(error.message || 'Login failed'); } } )

Login with phone and OTP using secure storage
loginWithOtpEnhanced
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/loginWithOtpEnhanced', async ( {phone, otp}: {phone: string; otp: string}, {dispatch, rejectWithValue} ) => { try { // Use RTK Query mutation const result = await dispatch( authApi.endpoints.verifyOtp.initiate({phone, otp}) ).unwrap(); // Store token in secure storage if (result.token) { try { await saveJWT(result.token); console.log('[Auth] JWT token saved to secure storage (enhanced)'); } catch (storageError) { console.error( '[Auth] Failed to save JWT token (enhanced):', storageError ); if (storageError instanceof SecureStorageError) { dispatch(logout()); dispatch({ type: 'ui/setError', payload: 'Unable to save login session. Please try again.', }); return rejectWithValue('Secure storage unavailable'); } } } return result; } catch (error: any) { return rejectWithValue(error.message || 'Login failed'); } } )

Enhanced login with RTK Query integration and secure storage
logoutUser
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/logout', async (_, {dispatch}) => { try { // Clear secure storage try { await clearJWT(); console.log('[Auth] JWT cleared from secure storage'); } catch (storageError) { console.error('[Auth] Failed to clear JWT token:', storageError); if (storageError instanceof SecureStorageError) { // Set user-visible warning but continue with logout dispatch({ type: 'ui/setError', payload: 'Session may not be fully cleared. Please restart the app.', }); } // Continue with logout even if storage clear fails } // In real app, call logout API to invalidate token // await authService.logout(); console.log('[Auth] Logout successful'); return true; } catch (error) { console.error('[Auth] Logout error:', error); // Still dispatch logout even if other operations fail return true; } } )

Logout and clear secure storage
logoutUserEnhanced
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/logoutUserEnhanced', async (_, {dispatch}) => { try { // Call logout API (optional - for server-side session cleanup) try { await dispatch(authApi.endpoints.logoutUser.initiate()).unwrap(); } catch (error) { // Continue with logout even if API call fails console.warn( '[Auth] Logout API call failed, continuing with local logout:', error ); } // Clear secure storage try { await clearJWT(); console.log('[Auth] JWT cleared from secure storage (enhanced)'); } catch (storageError) { console.error( '[Auth] Failed to clear JWT token (enhanced):', storageError ); if (storageError instanceof SecureStorageError) { dispatch({ type: 'ui/setError', payload: 'Session may not be fully cleared. Please restart the app.', }); } } // Reset API cache dispatch(authApi.util.resetApiState()); return true; } catch (error) { console.error('[Auth] Logout error (enhanced):', error); // Still return success for local logout return true; } } )

Enhanced logout with API call and secure storage
refreshTokenThunk
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/refreshToken', async (_, {getState, rejectWithValue}) => { try { const state = getState() as {auth: AuthState}; const {refreshToken} = state.auth; if (!refreshToken) { return rejectWithValue('No refresh token available'); } // Simulate API call await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000)); // In real app, call refresh token API // const response = await authService.refreshToken(refreshToken); const newTokens = { token: `refreshed_token_${Date.now()}`, refreshToken: `refreshed_refresh_${Date.now()}`, }; // Store new token await setStorageItem(STORAGE_KEYS.AUTH_TOKEN, newTokens.token); console.log('[Auth] Token refreshed successfully'); return newTokens; } catch (error: any) { console.error('[Auth] Token refresh error:', error); return rejectWithValue(error.message || 'Token refresh failed'); } } )

Refresh Token Async Thunk
restoreAuthState
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/restoreAuthState', async (_, {getState, dispatch, rejectWithValue}) => { try { console.log('[Auth] Starting auth state restoration...'); const state = getState() as {auth: AuthState}; const {isLoggedIn, user, token: reduxToken} = state.auth; console.log('reduxToken', reduxToken); // Check if JWT token exists in secure storage let secureToken: string | undefined; try { secureToken = await getJWT(); console.log('[Auth] Secure storage check completed successfully'); } catch (error) { console.error( '[Auth] Failed to retrieve JWT from secure storage:', error ); // Log detailed error information for debugging if (__DEV__) { console.error('[Auth] Secure storage error details:', { error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error', stack: error instanceof Error ? error.stack : undefined, isSecureStorageError: error instanceof SecureStorageError, currentAuthState: {isLoggedIn, hasUser: !!user}, }); } if (error instanceof SecureStorageError) { // If secure storage is inaccessible and user appears logged in, logout for safety if (isLoggedIn) { console.warn( '[Auth] Secure storage error - logging out for safety' ); dispatch(logout()); } return rejectWithValue({ type: 'SECURE_STORAGE_ERROR', message: 'Secure storage unavailable', originalError: error.message, }); } // For other errors, assume no token exists but continue restoration console.warn( '[Auth] Non-critical secure storage error - continuing with restoration' ); secureToken = undefined; } console.log( '[Auth] State check - Redux logged in:', isLoggedIn, 'Secure token exists:', !!secureToken ); // Case 1: Redux says logged in but no secure token - logout if (isLoggedIn && !secureToken) { console.warn( '[Auth] Logged in state but no secure token - logging out' ); dispatch(logout()); return { action: 'logout', reason: 'No secure token found', }; } // Case 2: Redux says logged out but secure token exists - could restore but play it safe if (!isLoggedIn && secureToken) { console.warn( '[Auth] Secure token exists but not logged in - clearing token for consistency' ); try { await clearJWT(); } catch (clearError) { console.error('[Auth] Failed to clear orphaned token:', clearError); } return { action: 'clear_orphaned_token', reason: 'Token exists but user not logged in', }; } // Case 3: Both logged in and token exists - validate consistency if (isLoggedIn && secureToken) { console.log('[Auth] Auth state is consistent - user remains logged in'); return { action: 'maintain', reason: 'State is consistent', }; } // Case 4: Both logged out and no token - all good console.log( '[Auth] User is logged out and no token exists - state is consistent' ); return { action: 'maintain', reason: 'User is properly logged out', }; } catch (error) { console.error('[Auth] Auth restoration failed:', error); // Log detailed error information if (__DEV__) { console.error('[Auth] Restoration error details:', { error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error', stack: error instanceof Error ? error.stack : undefined, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), }); } return rejectWithValue({ type: 'RESTORATION_ERROR', message: 'Auth restoration failed', originalError: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error', }); } } )

Restore authentication state on app startup Validates Redux state against secure storage JWT token
selectAuthError
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.error
selectCurrentUser
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.user
selectIsLoading
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.isLoading
selectIsLoggedIn
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.isLoggedIn
selectIsSendingOtp
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.isSendingOtp
selectToken
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.token
selectUser
Default value : (state: {auth: AuthState}) => state.auth.user
sendOtpThunk
Default value : createAsyncThunk( 'auth/sendOtp', async (phone: string, {rejectWithValue}) => { try { // Simulate API call await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1500)); // In real app, this would call your OTP API // const response = await otpService.sendOtp(phone); // For demo, always succeed console.log(`[Auth] OTP sent to ${phone}`); return {phone}; } catch (error: any) { console.error('[Auth] Send OTP error:', error); return rejectWithValue(error.message || 'Failed to send OTP'); } } )

Send OTP Async Thunk
Default value : authSlice.actions

src/navigation/AuthStack.tsx

AuthStack
Type : React.FC
Default value : () => { const theme = useAppTheme(); return ( <Stack.Navigator screenOptions={{ headerStyle: { backgroundColor: theme.colors.primary, }, headerTintColor: theme.colors.onPrimary, headerTitleStyle: { fontWeight: 'bold', }, cardStyle: { backgroundColor: theme.colors.background, }, }} > <Stack.Screen name="Login" component={LoginScreen} options={{ title: 'Welcome to Solarium', headerShown: false, // Login screen has its own header design }} /> {/* ← ADD THIS NEW SCREEN */} <Stack.Screen name="OTPVerification" component={OTPVerificationScreen} options={{ title: 'Verify OTP', headerShown: true, headerBackTitleVisible: false, }} /> </Stack.Navigator> ); }

Auth Stack Navigator
Stack
